replies.body:
Right now, 46 of 132 picks. (34.8%)

Thats from 16 teams and 18 games (meaning 180 champions were picked)

out of those 46:

10 were only picked once
19 were picked 2-4 times
14 were picked 5-9 times
3 were picked 10 times or more (Ezreal, Nami, Karma)


I didnt took note on the bans, so thats only the pick number)

>I didnt took note on the bans, so thats only the pick number)

If you want to know something utterly disgusting Nidalee has over a 90% ban rate with a 100% P/B.

Rek'Sai and Gragas got ran over by the nerfmobile, so she became the resident top cat. Instead of a trading of 2 top picks, we are down to one top pick, then the next tier down. Better to trade tier 2 than fight over the only tier 1 jungler.
With Rek'sai still being a highly contested pick ;)

Very much still playable, but no longer sitting on top of the tier list. Tier 2 or 3 now, depending more on a person's champion pool than just being the best.

I think we'll see a bit more of her once we get away from the B01 group stage and people have some leeway in their picks.
No, Rek'sai is definitely at the top of the tier list along with Nidalee, Elise, and Lee sin.
Rek'sai is still pick/ban. Its right at the top with Nidalee.
And GP was the same last season.

Nidalee became the sole top tier when the tier above her (Gragas and Rek'Sai) got some heavy nerfs.
They did hit her jungle a bit before, but she still sits above the next tier down.
Shyvana is still sitting in her Sejuanai'd state. and pretty effectively unplayable at pro level.
Kha'zix, might have enough clearspeed and whatnot in his kit to be workable though.
Pro-tier junglers are those who have strong AoE abilities to help clear, which lets them get to ganking quickly. They also generally have some sort of jump or dash that can bypass terrain, again further speeding up clear times and making ganks happen earlier on. The faster you can clear, the faster you can gank and start snowballing your lanes.
Darius was the same way the first week of last worlds. Wait until week 2 to see if this trend continues, because most of the Nidalee play at worlds so far has been garbage.

One of the most powerful jack of trades in the game not doing 'well'? 
One of the strongest AD burst combos in the game not doing 'well'?
One of the most mobile champions in the game not doing 'well'?

People like to think lee sin is bad, but the fact remains that he has one of the largest playerbases and a good winrate to compliment that playerbase.
He had a 46% winrate. Still has a 48%. That's not doing well.
On a very high skill ceiling champ that is in fact doing well.  In fact 48% on champ that requires that much skill is downright amazing if you ask me.
with a 22% play rate.... of course he is going to be under 50%. Anyone else with those numbers would of been nerfed not buffed like lee was

Really? I'd like to see that, because I seriously doubt that. And low winrates for high playrates only goes so far. 46% is way out of that range, and 48 is pushing it.

Also he still doesn't break 50% in 125+ games played.

go to the champgg site where you got your stat and see the play rate.... its not that hard; wait it is.

Here is the link for you lazy ass

http://champion.gg/champion/LeeSin

His play rate is almost 4x the average. Other champs get nerfed for that shit. the only reason lee has a low win rate is casue of trash players that attempt LCS big plays. If the top 7% played him he would be closer to 55% i bet.

Pickrate is also relevant, and Lee Sin has had the highest amongst junglers since season 2, on every single patch, undisputed. Of course he has a lower than average winrate, he's viewed as the default. People pick Lee when they're forced to jungle, or when they don't have a jungler who fits the team. 

Add to that the fact that he's an AD jungler who isn't a tank, two things which logically reduce winrate since it's common for idiots to pick a full AD or glass cannon comp and you have a recipe for a low winrate jungler.

Lee Sin at 48% is godlike in terms of strength. That means that all the things that should drag his winrate down up to 5% when he's in a balanced state are not effecting him.

As I said in another comment, 46% is way out of the boundary of "high playrates = low winrates", and 48% is pushing it.

The guy also doesn't break a 50% winrate with 125+ games on him

Worlds meta is a bit different then standard LCS. Support is probably one of the most diverse roles right now (Bard, Alistar, Nami, Braum, and some Karma)

Still, I'm surprised to hear that Nami is being picked.
I thought it was Bard, Alistar, Braum, Karma and Trundle that were the majority of support picks.

I mean... sure, you can see a odd Nami, but you can also see some odd Zilean and stuff. Because it was picked once or twice doesn't really make it a major pick.

Nami has been picked nearly every single game that's played in Group stage so far. I'm not even kidding, plus the only time we saw Zilean was when he went midlane though I will admit there have been quite a few Braums and I want to say one or two Bards but the Bards tend to be banned out more often then not. There was an Alistar or two as well but for the most part Nami > every other support at Worlds atm.

To be fair, we've also seen some {{champion:61}}  at worlds, something that wasn't seen at all this season really, and you left out {{champion:126}}  which is a pretty dominant pick. Idk if there's any others as I haven't seen all the matches, but those are a few examples.

He purposely left out tons of people. Off the top of my head, Jayce, Ori, Kennen, Vlad, Ryze, Sivir, Ali, Braum, Ashe, Elise, Nocturne, Graves, Shen, Irelia, Kled, Nidalee, ASol, Poppy, Lucian, Kench, Olaf, Malz, Soraka, Gnar, Jinx, Ryze, Skarner, Hecarim, Viktor ... oh look over double the pool he originally mentioned. Not to mention target bans like Thresh, Zac, Bard, LB off the top of my head. I'm sure I've missed some, and this is literally the first 3 days, all in Bo1. You're supposed to pick safe picks. In quarters we may see more comfort/off-meta stuff when you have B03/5 to see how the other team reacts, but in Bo1 it behooves you to go for the stronger/safer picks because you can't make as many in-game changes. If you lose, that's it. You can't dangle a pick and see how they respond, then go for the reverse-sweep. Not to mention, every time Riot reworks/releases a champ, they're now made with competitive in mind. Kled, Taliyah, Illaoi, ASol, and jhin have all had some decent LCS play, as well as reworked champs like poppy, Taric, shen, and ryze. Do people actually expect the likes of Amumu, Xin Zhao, Trynd, and Yi to be in LCS? They're just stat balls, and have other champs that can do their jobs better. Eventually, all champs will at least have a chance to be in worlds, but ATM why would anybody pick Garen? He's not trash tier, but he doesn't offer anything that actually matters

There was also ashe, lucian, Graves, kled(?!), vlad, skarner, bard, braum and many more that were picked once in a while.

Yea there are 100+ champs, but this isnt bronze when you can build annie ADC and win, in LCS they play on strategic level where comps are way more important than specific champion.
There will always be champions who excel at specific niche and the meta right now favors them, last year we had FUCKING URGOT and he got old fast until he was dropped outta meta.

Every LCS is like this, it's meta picks, the meta changes not the inidividual picks.

Watch it for the interactions of the teams not to watch off pick teemo

More than one champ can be disgusting at any given time. In the case of jungle Nid is the worst offender, but Lee Sin, Elise and Rek'sai are all pretty bad too.

Few things contribute to this:

* It's best of 1's, meaning that no team wants to bust out a secret strat. (You gotta pick safe stuff or risk losing.)
* The pick-ban phase is awful, which will hopefully be fixed next year.
* A lot of the champs who could have used buffs (COUGH BRAND COUGH) had these buffs revoked because they were "fine" in solo queue.

Again: If you wanna see pro diversity, you have to let Riot balance around pros. But nobody is willing to do that.

In a Best-of-one, people don't deviate from known good picks.
You don't get a second chance.
There's no room to experiment.

Once we are out of group stage and the Bo1, you will see some pick deviation.
